contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Museum |name = Hong Kong Heritage Museum |image = Hong Kong Heritage Museum 1.jpg |imagesize = |caption = The Hong Kong Heritage Museum in Sha Tin |pushpin_map = Hong Kong |map_type = Hong Kong |map_caption = |latitude = 22.37712 |longitude = 114.18533 |established = 2000 |dissolved = |location = 1 Man Lam Road, Sha Tin, Hong Kong |type = [[History museum]] |visitors = 2,000,000,000 |director = |curator = |publictransit = [[Che Kung Temple Station]] |website = [http://www.heritagemuseum.gov.hk Official Website] }} '''Hong Kong Heritage Museum''' ({{zh|t=香港文化博物館}}) is a [[museum]] of [[history]], [[art]] and [[culture]] in [[Sha Tin]], [[Hong Kong]], by the [[Shing Mun River]]. The museum opened on 16 December 2000. It is managed by the [[Leisure and Cultural Services Department]] of the [[Hong Kong Government]].<ref name="about us">[http://www.heritagemuseum.gov.hk/eng/aboutus/themuseum.aspx Hong Kong Heritage Museum website: about us]</ref> The six permanent exhibits and the original temporary exhibits were designed by design firm Reich+Petch along with Lord Cultural Resources. ==Features== The Museum has been designed to provide comprehensive exhibitions on history, art and culture. The Museum offers a diverse range of dynamic and interactive exhibitions and programmes to engage visitors in enjoyable and educational experiences as they appreciate the valuable artefacts on display. It also houses a cafe and museum shop. There are six permanent exhibition [[Art gallery|galleries]] for the display of the museum's collections and six thematic galleries for temporary exhibitions.<ref name="about us"/> Permanent galleries include: * [[New Territories]] Heritage Hall * Children's Discovery Gallery * [[Cantonese Opera]] Heritage Hall * T.T.Tsui Gallery of Chinese Art, displaying artifacts from the former [[Tsui Museum of Art]] * [[Chao Shao-an]] Gallery Other than galleries, the museum has a theatre for various performing arts and talks. ==Branch museums== [[Image:Xiaosheng with kao.jpg|200px|thumb|right|Cantonese Opera exhibit at the Museum]] The museum runs three branch museums:<ref>[http://www.heritagemuseum.gov.hk/eng/museums/museums.aspx Hong Kong Heritage Museum website: branch museums]</ref> * [[Hong Kong Railway Museum]] ([[Tai Po]]) * [[Sam Tung Uk Museum]] (in a former [[Hakka people|Hakka]] [[walled village]], [[Tsuen Wan]]) * [[Sheung Yiu Folk Museum]] (in a former Hakka village, [[Sai Kung]]) ==Transport== The museum is served by numerous bus lines. It is also reachable by [[MTR]]: * [[East Rail Line]]: 15-minute walk from either [[Tai Wai (KCRC)|Tai Wai]] or [[Sha Tin (KCRC)|Sha Tin]] station * [[Ma On Shan Line]]: 5-minute walk across the river from [[Che Kung Temple (KCRC)|Che Kung Temple]] station ==See also== * [[Museums in Hong Kong]] * [[History of Hong Kong]] * [[Culture of Hong Kong]] * [[Heritage conservation in Hong Kong]] * [[Hong Kong Heritage Discovery Centre]] * [[Hong Kong Museum of History]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{commons category}} [[Category:Museums in Hong Kong]] [[Category:Sha Tin]] [[Category:Tai Wai]] [[Category:Rural history museums]] [[Category:Living museums]] [[Category:Art museums and galleries in Hong Kong]] [[Category:Local museums in China]]
